intro: Lycianthes cutacensis, commonly known as the cutacensis gooseberry, is a species native to Central America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes and peppers, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellow berries that are typically harvested when fully mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and research settings.
